b: No advertisements ~ No data sharing & monetization ~ No analytics ~ No third party libraries
the complete solution for all outdoor activities and sports
on-line topographic maps, which will remain available
you are localized in real-time on the map
Don’t hesitate, try the free Lite version right now!
Don’t hesitate, use this Lite version right now for free!
KMZ Overlays, OziExplorer OZFx2, OZFx3 (partly) and calibrated images, GeoTiff, GeoPackage GeoPkg, MbTile, SqliteDB
ShapeFile SHP/PRJ/DBF, OziExplorer WPT/PLT, GeoJSON, IGC tracks, Geocaching LOC
No advertisements ~ No data sharing & monetization ~ No analytics ~ No third party libraries
Once displayed, maps are stored and remain available, quickly, even with no network access
Want more than just roads on your maps?
Used to go to places with poor network coverage?

This Plus version includes all features of the Standard version without ads, and supports import of professional GPS and geographic placemarks file formats (waypoints, routes, tracks, areas) like GPX, Google Earth KML/KMZ (map overlays not supported), Ozi Explorer WPT/PLT, CVS/TSV and Geocaching LOC
Display, store and retrieve unlimited placemarks
string: Maps are retrieved from the Internet. Eveything that is displayed is stored locally to remain available when offline. \nThere are plenty of maps and layers available.
If you need a complete outdoor solution with offline maps, check out our other application, AlpineQuest. It comes with many more features, like a powerful GPS and barometric location tracker:
Failed to detect or use a suitable storage location.
Would you like to configure it now?
No more space available on this storage.
Thanks for sending us this report containing %s error(s).

If you want to record a track or get warnings when following a path or when using proximity alerts, even if the main application window is closed or if the screen is off, the application requires access to your location in the background.
Locations collected in the background will be strictly used for the requested features and will only remain in the application.
Do you want to allow the application to access your location in the background in addition to normal location access?
You must allow the requested permission to use this feature.
This file has already been imported. Open existing or import again?
This item already exists, replace it?
Folders help you organise your items easily.
You’ve not granted to the application the right to access your files.
Some files may not be displayed.
We need you! Support us by leaving a comment on the %s Store!
To get help, ask any question, report bugs, don’t hesitate:
Before using the application, please read, understand and agree the Psyberia EULA:

All images, values and measurements given by this application are indicative and may contain errors. Always use it in conjunction with official sources and your common sense, make sure you have all the necessary equipment and training, take all sensible precautions, and be aware of the risks.
Unstable beta version, use with caution.
This version of the application has been illegally modified and may contain viruses. Please only use official versions.
You don’t have any backup yet.
Backup the app data on a regular basis to avoid any loss.
Large amount of data, manual backup is recommended.
The amount of data to backup is too large.
Almost done! \n\nDon’t forget to copy the backup file on your favorite cloud service to keep it safe.
This restoration process will delete and replace some files on your device, it should only be used after a new app install.
At the end of the restoration process, the application will restart.
Files already present on the device won’t be restored.
Files already present on the device will be replaced.
Long-press a menu button from the map view to call its first item.
Long-press volume button (-) to lock and unlock the map from touches, press return button to unlock.
Long-press volume button (+) to display next view.
Modifying advanced settings may cause instabilities or crashes, use with caution.
For legal reasons, this feature is disabled for the following map(s):
The map you’ve selected contains no data at the current location, which will result in an empty screen.
Do you want to slide the map view to a covered area?
No favourite map or set defined yet
You can save your changes as a favorite map or map set.
The configuration of maps currently displayed will be replaced and lost.
Do you want to save it as a favourite set?
Clear all the stored data of this map?
You can browse and install new maps from the community:
Create a point on the map.
Take a picture and associate it to a point on the map.
Create multiple waypoints on the map, managed all together.
Create multiple ordered waypoints on the map drawing a route.
Manually draw a surface area on the map.
Manually draw a path on the map.
Create a new file to store various placemarks.
Be notified when approaching this location.
Add some text on the map.
Create a circular area based on a given radius distance from the screen centre.
Measure distances and bearings between two or more points on the map.
Compute slopes between two or more points.
Automatically draw a path following the roads on the map.
Set the target at least %s in advance
Warn me if I go more than %s away
Don’t warn me if I go away
Start all displayed tracks at the same time
The search failed. \nYou need to have an Internet data access to search a location by name.
There is no location source available on this device.
Uses locations provided by Outdoor GPS/GNSS and Network geolocation.
Provides accurate locations computed from various GNSS (GPS/GLONASS/Galileo/BeiDou/IRNSS/QZSS) satellites (no network needed). Requires view of sky and initializing time.
Provides inaccurate locations computed from the cellular networks.
Uses locations provided by third party applications, for example when using an external GNSS receiver.
Battery consuming, for short runs with volatile speed.
Economy mode recommended for day long hikes.
Cannot activate the compass: no magnetic sensor on this device.
Rotate your device in all directions to calibrate the magnetic sensor.
Compute declination to get true (geographical) north
To get precise results using the barometer, you need to calibrate it. \nPlace yourself at a known elevation (you may use the GNSS altitude) and enter it as a reference.
The current reference pressure is %s at %s.
Resume last recorded track or start a new one?
Failed to save the current track recorder data. Delete last recorded track?
Increase the notifications volume to hear alerts.
Skip locations if I’m not moving
Record pressure values to compute more precise barometric elevations
The agent has been killed by the system!
You must allow %s to run in the background from your device settings to use this feature while the screen is off.
You must disable battery optimizations for %s to use this feature while the screen is off.
Use the main menu button to display the top status bar temporarily.
Also hide the software navigation buttons when displaying the map in full screen.
Never turn the screen off when displaying the map view.
Do not require to unlock the keyguard screen to use this application.
Define where to store downloaded maps.
Your system prevents usage of this location.
This location will be deleted by the system when you uninstall the application.
If you use a maintenance application, it may delete this location.
Using external memory (MicroSD) may lead to slowdowns, freezes, file problems, and is not recommended.
Use the media folder to store pictures, audio files and exported files.
Define the style and orientation of menus.
Define the size and background colour of the information boxes displayed on the map.
Define which actions to trigger when long-pressing the map.
Define zoom controls behavior and display on the map.
Double-tap the map on the same point to zoom in, double-tap different points to zoom out.
Volume buttons zoom in or zoom out the map
Long-press zoom buttons change map display resolution
Tap then press and move finger up/down to zoom
Define how grids are displayed on the map.
Allow to control the map zoom by pitching two fingers on the map.
Allow to control the map orientation by turning two fingers on the map.
Allow to control the map perspective by moving down two fingers on the map.
Display size of the map on the screen.
Size of placemarks (paths, waypoints, icons) displayed on the map.
Default colour of placemaks displayed on the map.
Colour of targeted placemark displayed on the map.
Display options for recorded tracks displayed on the map.
Display a border for placemarks displayed on the map.
Display a shadow under placemarks displayed on the map.
Improve accuracy of tracks by filtering and correcting points before display.
Automatically move the screen centre over the current GNSS location after 10s of inactivity.
Automatically activate explorer mode when pitching the map down with two fingers.
Display the previous GNSS locations on the map.
Define how to display the current GNSS course on the map.
Disable real-time location when the application is hidden to save battery.
does not apply to the track recorder
Compute more precise elevations using the EGM96 geoid model.
Define how to display the current compass heading on the map.
Warn me if the GNSS signal is lost or too weak.
Ask for the current activity when starting the track recorder or a new segment/lap.
While recording a track, reset the “done so far” statistics when starting a new segment/lap.
When active, the track recorder automatically stops and resumes with the application.
Enter any coordinate system WKT/PROJ definition, or any EPSG/ESRI/SR-ORG ID from %s.
Coordinate system “%s” is not supported yet. Please contact us on our support forum for any question about it.
Sorry, no suitable application is currently installed on your device to handle this action.
Sorry, the external application used is not compatible with this application.
Real elevations, computed from the GNSS altitudes and shape of the Earth.
Real elevations, computed from the calibrated pressure data, usually more precise than the GNSS altitudes.
Differences between the barometric and geoid elevations.
Instant speeds, computed from the GNSS locations and times.
Slope values between each successive locations, computed from the GNSS or barometric altitudes (if available).
Uncalibrated pressures, as given by the barometer.
Calibrated pressures at the sea level, computed from the GNSS altitudes and raw pressure data.
Accuracy of the locations, with a 68% confidence.
Strength of the network protocol signal in use (2G/3G/4G/5G).
Allows the application to display maps from %s files.
Allows the application to download and store for offline use elevation data of remote areas.
Adds new maps and layers based on stored elevation data like heights, terrain, hillshading, slopes, etc.
The map you’ve selected is oversized for your Android version and some parts may fail to load. \n\nTry to split this map in different parts, smaller than 2GB.
First, log in to suggest a map to add.
The application couldn’t load the entire file which looks like corrupted.
The application couldn’t load the entire file due to insufficient memory.
Allows the application to import placemarks from %s files.
Allows the application to export placemarks to %s files.
Fix GPS week number rollover issues
Sorry, right now Community Placemarks is only available in the full or activated versions.
Save your placemarks online, share them with your friends.
First, log in to make purchases.
Wrong username or password provided, please try again.
Don’t have an account yet? Create one right now for free!
%s already exists, please choose another one.
An email verification PIN code has been sent by email.
Failed to connect to the server, working offline.
The server is currently under maintenance.
Too much sessions currently opened. Please log off from one of those devices:
Modifications successfully sent to the server.
Failed to send modifications to the server. Please check your last modifications.
Your version is no more supported, please update the application.
Local data will be deleted, including all data not yet synchronized.
Points of interest (POIs) you created or modified.
Add users as friends to access their shared data.
Allows you to browse a hidden sub-folder.
Share some information on a place, that will be visible on the map to all other users.
Before creating a new point of interest, please check that a similar one doesn’t already exist.
Points of interest are visible to all users, do not enter any personal information.
Please choose carefully the point icon: it will be visible on the map to all users.
This feature is not available in this free version.
Enjoy all features of AlpineQuest and support us by using the complete version, all future updates included.
Activate the application only if requested. \nIf you’ve purchased the complete version on the Play Store, do not activate but use the dedicated version.
